poem:
**End of an Era**

Power grips loosen their hold,  
as whispers of change wend through  
the marble halls. Eighty-three years  
breathe a sigh, steady in departure.  
Critics' scorn mingles with allies' praise,  
both fade in waning echoes—  
the quiet hum of history shifts:  
A new song, yet to be composed.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The Associated Press broke the news of McConnell’s retirement on Thursday, which marked the Republican senator’s 83rd birthday. McConnell formally announced his retirement in a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
